ACT
110
Retention of various rights on the occasion of assignment and distribution
On the occasion of assignment and distribution, the assignor may for himself and/or his spouse, or for any other person, determine the establishment of a personal easement or real burden on all or some of the objects of assignment, or contract a lifetime annuity in kind or in money, or alimony for life, or some other compensation.
If the rights from paragraph 1 of this article are established for the transferor and his spouse jointly, in the event of the death of one, they belong to the other as a whole until his death, unless otherwise agreed or arising from the circumstances of the case.
